Posts.Content: renaedarlene wrote: I am supposed to start chemo tomorrow, but still waiting on my insurance approval. Trying to do everything I can to feel empowered prior to going into this chapter.  I would love to hear stories of what others are doing to prepare for the big C-Day.  My greatest fear was my long hair falling out in chunks.  I've taken the advice of others and got my hair cut short.  Just received a list necessities pre-chemo from my cousin who also reads this site that is extremely helpful.  Who would have thought that we should have a new germless toothbrush?? I would have never thought of that.  Anyone that has any other ideas to share, would love to hear them.  Love and Peace, ~Renae~ My latest post is "It's Only Hair!" goodnewscolumn.blogspot.com.  Trying to find the silver lining during each chapter.   Renae Wilber Dx 11/7/2011, IDC, Right, 1cm, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pre-Chemo Haircut renaedarlene Momine

Posts.Content: renaedarlene wrote: If anyone is in this same boat I would sure appreciate your input.  I have a family history of breast cancer.  Statistically, a 23% chance of a new cancer or recurrence based on family history alone. I recently had a partial mastectomy (lumpectomy, nipple+areola) with clean margins and no lymph node involvement.  The standard of treatment is five years of Tamoxifen and six weeks of radiation. But....what about the malignant cells that could have entered my bloodstream? Being a Grade 2 and 1.8 cm. almost pushes me to a Stage 2.  I am awaiting the results of my Oncotype but am making myself crazy. Would love any comments.  Oh, also, the first Oncologist's percentage without chemo (based on stats) is 16% recurrence, 8% without.  On that alone, I want to go with the chemo, but I am just at a loss as to the biggest decision of my life. Help! Renae Wilber Dx 11/7/2011, IDC, Right, 1cm, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
